snippet: A court in São Tomé and Príncipe convicted the captain and two crew members of the Thunder, the culmination of a chase from Antarctica to the Gulf of Guinea.
abstract: Captain and two crew members of ship Thunder are convicted on illegal fishing charges by Sao Tome and Principe court; vessel, which was wanted by Interpol, sank off coast of West African island nation after 110-day chase by vigilante environmental group Sea Shepherd; verdict is rare and important setback for $20 billion-per-year illegal fishing industry.
lead_paragraph: A court in São Tomé and Príncipe convicted the captain and two crew members of the Thunder, the culmination of a chase from Antarctica to the Gulf of Guinea.

headline.print_headline: African Court Convicts Three From a Renegade Fishing Ship
headline.main: African Court Convicts Captain of Renegade Ship in Illegal Fishing Case
